string.text: If you have Coverdrave's Reworked RF Receiver addon installed, checking this option will make NERFS use that addon's MCM settings for equip state, beeps, and frequency changes. All other RRFR improvements are included in NERFS.

Noisy, but contains useful debugging information. If you are reporting an issue, please FIRST:

 1. Enable this setting.
 2. Exit the game completely.
 3. Reload the game and reproduce the issue WITHOUT other addons, if possible.
 4. Exit the game.
 4. Zip up the game log from [anomaly_folder]/appdata/logs and put it somewhere online.

The RF Receiver can display a maximum of three digits, but is clamped to VHF ranges (30-300 Mhz). However, some vanilla signal sources are outside of that range. This setting expands both the frequency range of the detector and the range that the game uses when giving out tasks.
Minimal Framework Version for 'Devices of Anomaly Redone' Inclusion

New Extensible RF Sources improves the RF Detector in multiple ways:
 • Expands the frequency range from 300 to 999 (configurable below).
 • Adds interesting new sources of RF noise.
 • Moves all RF sources into an extensible LTX-based framework designed to be moddable and conflict-free.
 • Adds lootable notes (with accompanying encyclopedia articles) that can be randomly found on dead stalkers, allowing players to learn about useful frequencies through gameplay (full version only - link below).
 • Adds an optional HUD indicator of signal strength, for accessibility or preference.
 • Includes support for Reworked RF Receiver and TB's RF Tasks.
For more information, or to download the full version of NERFS, see the Moddb page:\nhttps://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-anomaly/addons/new-extensible-rf-sources

The accessibility widget is a simple HUD visual indicator for RF signal strength. It is intended for deaf and hearing-impaired persons, but can be used by anyone who finds the audio cues hard to tell apart from background noise. Position and colors of the indicator can be customized for preference or color-blindness. The widget will ONLY appear when the player has the RF Detector device out.\n

The indicator will flash this color when signal strength is low.
 Default (grey): 255,50,50,50

The indicator will flash this color when signal strength is high.
 Default (green): 255,0,250,0

The indicator will flash this color during emissions.
 Default (red): 128,200,0,0
0,0 is the upper-left corner, 1024,768 is the lower-right corner.\n The game converts this to whatever your resolution is. The default (lower center) is 491,670.

If enabled, the mouse wheel can be scrolled up and down to change frequency. Just as in vanilla, holding Shift or Alt will change the increment to 10 or 50, respectively. These go by much more quickly when scrolling!\n This feature requires modded binaries version 20230701 or newer. It is not currently supported by GAMMA.
You can define up to nine preset frequencies and assign a different hotkey to each.
If mousewheel support is enabled, you can also hold Ctrl while scrolling in order to cycle through the presets below.
